info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 9 at 9:30PM EDT until July 10 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Delaware...
Red Clay Creek At Wooddale affecting New Castle County.
For the Red Clay Creek...including Wooddale...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Red Clay Creek at Wooddale.
* WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Flooding begins in adjacent open fields. At 7.5 feet, Barley Mill Road begins to flood. Brandywine Springs Park floods. At 8.5 feet, Flooding begins near Old Capital Trail and Newport Road. At 10.0 feet, West Rolling Mill Road floods. Creek Road between Pyles Ford Road and Way Road is closed due to flooding.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 5.7 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 9.5 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 07/28/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi.
The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 930 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING
